bill_title: revise certain definitions regarding criminal street gang activity.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain definitions regarding criminal street gang activity. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 22-10A-1 be amended to read: 22-10A-1. Terms used in §§ 22-10A-1 to 22-10A-3, inclusive, mean: (1) "Street gang," any formal or informal ongoing organization, association, or group of three or more persons who have a common name or common identifying signs, colors, or symbols and have members or associates who, individually or collectively, engage in or have engaged in a pattern of street gang activity; (2) "Street gang activity," a street gang member's commission, attempted commission, conspiracy to commit, or solicitation to commit any crime of violence as defined in subdivision 22-1-2(9) or the commission, attempted commission, conspiracy to commit, or solicitation to commit any offense involving; (a) Possession or use of a weapon; (b) Theft or possession of stolen property or a vehicle; (c) Burglary or criminal trespass; (d) Intentional damage to property; (e) Assault; (f) Stalking; (g) Pimping, promoting prostitution, or human trafficking; (h) Manufacturing, sale, distribution, or trafficking of any illegal drug; (i) Disorderly conduct; (j) Resisting arrest; (k) Eluding or aggravated eluding; (l) Threatening a law enforcement officer or the family of a law enforcement officer; or (m) Tampering with a witness; (3) "Street gang member," any person who engages in a pattern of street gang activity and who meets two or more of the following criteria: (a) Admits to gang membership; (b) Is identified as a gang member by a documented reliable informant; (c) Resides in or frequents a particular gang's area and adopts its style of dress, its use of hand signs or its tattoos and associates with known gang members; (d) Wears certain articles of clothing, colors, or insignia commonly associated with street gang activity, other than part of a fashion trend, that indicate membership in a street gang; (e) Has tattoos that indicate membership in a street gang; (f) Uses hand signs, speech patterns, slang, or other mannerisms that identify the person as a gang member; (g) Authors any written or electronic correspondence indicating membership in a street gang; (h) Admits to the use of a moniker commonly associated with a street gang; (i) Is identified as a gang member by an informant of previously untested reliability if such the identification is corroborated by independent information; (e)(j) Has been arrested more than once in the company of identified gang members for offenses which that are consistent with usual gang activity; (f)(k) Is identified as a gang member by physical evidence, such as photographs or other documentation; or (g)(l) Has been stopped or documented in the company of known gang members four or more times; and (3)(4) "Pattern of street gang activity," the commission, attempted commission, or solicitation by any member or members of a street gang of two or more felony or violent misdemeanor offenses instances of street gang activity on separate occasions within a three-year period for the purpose of furthering gang activity. Section 2. That § 22-10A-2 be amended to read: 22-10A-2. The penalty for conviction of any offense shall be reclassified to the next highest classification in the penalty schedule if the commission of such offense is part of a pattern of street gang activity. Section 3. That § 22-10A-3 be amended to read: 22-10A-3. An allegation that a defendant is a street gang member shall be filed as a separate information at the time of, or before, arraignment. The separate information shall state those criteria, as set forth in subdivision 22-10A-1(2), which § 22-10A-1, that allegedly identify the defendant as a street gang member, and shall be signed by the prosecutor. The prosecutor shall sign the separate information.
